result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J. Writz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
15CF825:
Ct. 2 (Possession of THC)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, concurrent to all cases. CONDITIONS: Impose 9 Months MCJ w/Huber for work/school/treatment/or a combination, Serve 6 Months MCJ, Stay last 3 Months MCJ for rule violations, No objection to EMP, Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 10 Hours of Community Service per week, AODA and any follow up, Absolute Sobriety from drugs and alcohol, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 19 days Credit. Restitution in the amount of $650 to be paid- State to provide an Order for Restitution. 
COURT has strong recommendation for Defendant to attend Outpatient Treatment at Health Care Center.

Includes 15CF825, 15CF830, 15CF988, 15CF1209 and 15CM2281.   Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol or unless valid prescription for medications.  No controlled substances without valid prescription and only in the amounts prescribed.    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 with day reporting.    No contact with All American Taxi, Downtown Pawn, Wausau Gun & Loan, M.Z, Kwik Trip, Pawn America and Pick n Save.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
Court quashes warrants on all files.
